cluster_relations.rel_desc: The adult stage of a butterfly is characterized by a relatively short lifespan.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: ranging from a few days to a few weeks

cluster_relations.rel_desc: People around the world are described as having curiosity that is engaged by urban legends.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Story and Legend Audiences (including Cautionary Narratives)
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Psychological and Cultural Constructs of Urban Legends
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Urban Legends â€“ Folklore, Psychology & Scholarship

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when they encounter or hear urban legends
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: PsychologicalState: desire to know more stimulated by urban legends

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links a biological life stage or organism to its characteristic lifespan or longevity.
args.justification: The relation connects the adult stage of a butterfly to its characteristic lifespan range, which is a specific life-history property; 'has_lifespan' is an appropriate predicate for this kind of biological attribute.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links an entity (typically a person or group) to a psychological or mental attribute it exhibits.
args.justification: The relation expresses that people (as an audience) exhibit or possess the attribute of curiosity when exposed to urban legends; modeling this as a psychological attribute owned by the people fits well with 'has_psychological_attribute'.
The predicate describes a life-history characteristic (lifespan) of a biological life stage, which fits a specific class for life-history or demographic attributes.
The predicate links people to a psychological state/trait (curiosity), which is best grouped under a class for psychological or mental attributes.
Both relations express that a subject possesses or exhibits an attribute (lifespan; curiosity) rather than composition, causation, or hierarchy, so they belong to a broad ATTRIBUTE group.

The predicate describes a life-history characteristic (lifespan) of a biological life stage, which fits a specific class for life-history or demographic attributes.
The predicate links people to a psychological state/trait (curiosity), which is best grouped under a class for psychological or mental attributes.
Both relations express that a subject possesses or exhibits an attribute (lifespan; curiosity) rather than composition, causation, or hierarchy, so they belong to a broad ATTRIBUTE group.
